section.name: Why have custom goals?
section.P: Some of our components do not easily fit into the simple layout of this project. Furthermore, some of Maven's built-in goals are "works in progress" and do not do quite what they should. In previous iterations we have got around this by adding extra processing hanging on the front or end of existing built-in goals. However, this had the side effect that often we would be forced to run goals for a project which were not appropriate, and we would then often get build failure errors which we had to know it was OK to ignore. Furthermore, sometimes unintended jars and wars were built as a by-product of the hacked build process and this caused confusion for users. Hence, we have created custom goals that every component owner should implement. In many cases (as for this simple project), these goals will simply map directly onto existing Maven goals, but they give us the power and flexibility to vary the build if we need to.
